bug.author: cab1211
bug.summary: why use different format value for obj and cls in training and inference?
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
hi, thank you for your opening source for this repo. when I read the code, i find that you use the direct obj and cls value to conpute loss, but add an op of sigmoid when inference? <denchmark-h:h2>Code</denchmark-h>
training: lobj += BCEobj(pi[..., 4], tobj) # obj loss lcls += BCEcls(ps[:, 5:], t) # BCE inference: if 'default' in self.arc: # seperate obj and cls torch.sigmoid_(io[..., 4:])

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cab1211>@cab1211</denchmark-link> this is default behavior. You can read about it in the YOLO publications.
